bug.summary: Looping "Could not find namespace kubeflow-anonymous, wait and retry" on initial apply
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: Ran as per instructions in <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/kfctl-k8s-istio/</denchmark-link> . Operation did not exit but looped with these messages: <denchmark-code>WARN[0474] Could not find namespace kubeflow-anonymous, wait and retry: namespaces "kubeflow-anonymous" not found filename="kustomize/kustomize.go:353" WARN[0506] Could not find namespace kubeflow-anonymous, wait and retry: namespaces "kubeflow-anonymous" not found filename="kustomize/kustomize.go:353" WARN[0547] Could not find namespace kubeflow-anonymous, wait and retry: namespaces "kubeflow-anonymous" not found filename="kustomize/kustomize.go:353" </denchmark-code>
What did you expect to happen: I expected the command to exit successfully having applied the config. Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): I don't have this running yet - how is this different from version printed by kfctl? kfctl version: kfctl v0.6.2-0-g47a0e4c7 Kubernetes platform: microk8s Kubernetes version: Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"13", GitVersion:"v1.13.6", GitCommit:"abdda3f9fefa29172298a2e42f5102e777a8ec25", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-05-08T13:53:53Z", GoVersion:"go1.11.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"13", GitVersion:"v1.13.6", GitCommit:"abdda3f9fefa29172298a2e42f5102e777a8ec25", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-05-08T13:46:28Z", GoVersion:"go1.11.5", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"} OS: Linux 4.15.0-58-generic #64-Ubuntu SMP

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gar1t>@gar1t</denchmark-link> I believe that you saw this message during apply, not generate. Can you confirm? This is more of a UX issue than a bug. The kfctl code is waiting for the default namespace to be created before exiting. However the code should be of LogLevel info and not warn, since it is not an abnormal condition. In addition, I feel that the wording should be different to convey that this is a normal part of the installation. The current wording makes it seem like there is something wrong. How about: Waiting for default Profile namespace (kubeflow-anonymous) to be created...

Yes indeed - my apologies - that certainly was apply and not generated. I updated the issue to reflect this. The problem is that this is in a retry loop and, I believe, times-out with an error. I killed the process in each case assuming this was an issue with configuration.

Let me get you more info here. I see now that I need to let this run to completion - and if there's a timeout I'll investigate further. And yes - <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> your proposed message I think will do the trick wrt UX.

Here's the latest apply log. The operation in this case exited normally (0 exit code). In previous cases the operation failed (see above for last line of output with exit code). <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/files/3600545/apply.log>apply.log</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-h:h2>So here's what going on</denchmark-h>
kfctl tries to create a default profile in which to consume kubeflow
if kfctl can't identify the id of the user running kubeflow (currently true for all non GCP configs) then kfctl just creates a profile "kubeflow-namespace"
The logs indicate the creation of the profile INFO[0206] creating Profile/kubeflow-anonymous filename="kustomize/kustomize.go:447"
Here's a link to the relevant code
kubeflow/bootstrap/v2/pkg/kfapp/kustomize/kustomize.go
Line 338 in 6af406b
resourcesErr := kustomize.deployResources(kustomize.restConfig, body)
After the profile is created; the code waits for the namespace to be created. That's what the logs indicate WARN[0206] Could not find namespace kubeflow-anonymous, wait and retry: namespaces "kubeflow-anonymous" not found filename="kustomize/kustomize.go:353"
Relevant code
kubeflow/bootstrap/v2/pkg/kfapp/kustomize/kustomize.go
Line 352 in 6af406b
msg := fmt.Sprintf("Could not find namespace %v, wait and retry: %v", defaultProfileNamespace, nsErr)
So it looks like there is a problem creating the namespace associated with the profile and we eventually give up
<denchmark-h:h2>Further debugging</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/gar1t>@gar1t</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ashahba>@ashahba</denchmark-link> To debug this we need to figure out what why profile creation is failing could you please include the following
Output of kubectl -n kubeflow get profile -o yaml kubeflow-anonymous Output of kubectl -n kubeflow describe porfile kubeflow-anonymous Logs of profile controller
<denchmark-h:h2>Workaround</denchmark-h>
Creation of the default profile is the last step in Kubeflow setup so everything else should already be setup You can probably just create a suitable profile either the CLI or the UI in order to use kubeflow
<denchmark-h:h2>Conjecture on what the problem is</denchmark-h>
I think the problem is we set the user id to "kubeflow-anonymous"
https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/v0.6-branch/bootstrap/v2/pkg/kfapp/kustomize/kustomize.go#L326
I think the profile will then try to create some cluster RBAC bindings for this user
I suspect this is failing because there is no "kubeflow-anonymous" user as a result the profile controller throws an error before creating the namespace
/cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/krishnadurai>@krishnadurai</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yanniszark>@yanniszark</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Jeffwan>@Jeffwan</denchmark-link>

I can successfully set up the kubeflow on my centos VirtualBoxes now. Here's my instructions . Wish could do help for you.
For the issue here, I followed the workaround by @jlewi , and create the kubeflow-anonymous manually. After namespace issuse, when we do the kfctl apply again, I hit the issue #3810 . For this issue, I followed the suggestion by @jlewi , using following script(Modified a bit from original as we are already have "apply -k" in kubectl on 1.15.3).
<denchmark-code>#!/usr/bin/env bash
for i in $(cat app.yaml | grep '^ path: ' | awk -F: '{print $2}');do childdir=${i#*/} if [[ -d kustomize/$childdir && -f kustomize/$childdir/kustomization.yaml ]]; then #kustomize build kustomize/$childdir | kubectl apply -f - #Using following line instead , as we are already on 1.15.3 of kubectl. **kubectl apply -k "kustomize/$childdir"** sleep 3 fi done </denchmark-code>
NOTE: Kubeflow is a very long time setup process. There's a long list of docker images need tobe downloaded. Sometimes, they need the proxy, and some others would failed with proxy. So, this may need restart docker on your node with/without the proxy to make them all done.

Here's how I was able to resolve this one on my end. If ever you have already applied do this:
I deleted all my Kubeflow clusters
<denchmark-code>$ kfctl delete all --delete_storage </denchmark-code>
Deleted the istio-system namespace from Kubernetes --- so that the error on Port already being used won't happen
<denchmark-code>$ kubectl delete namespaces istio-system </denchmark-code>
Deleted the path I initialized
<denchmark-code>$ rm -rf <kapp_path> </denchmark-code>
Created a namespace kubeflow-anonymous
<denchmark-code>$ kubectl create namespace kubeflow-anonymous </denchmark-code>
Reinitialized, re-generated and re-applied
<denchmark-code>$ kfctl init ${KFAPP} --config=${CONFIG} -V $ cd ${KFAPP} $ kfctl generate all -V $ kfctl apply all -V </denchmark-code>
Verified if working
<denchmark-code>$ kubectl get pods -n kubeflow </denchmark-code>
If ever you're just going to start initializing, download the config files first and then add the kubeflow-anonymous namespace. Hope this helps someone. Props to: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wzxJayce>@wzxJayce</denchmark-link>

Had the same error with microk8s 1.14.6. However, after ~10 loops over this warning it exited with 0. And namespace was successfully created.

This should be fixed in 0.7.0 In 0.7.0 we only create the default profile for GCP because in that case we can get the email.
kubeflow/bootstrap/pkg/kfapp/coordinator/coordinator.go
Line 377 in dfd8b2b
if kfapp.KfDef.Spec.Email == "" || kfapp.KfDef.Spec.Platform != kftypesv3.GCP {
In 0.6 we had attempted to generalize that behavior to the case where if an email was provided in the KFDef we would use it to create a default profile. That caused problems though in the anonymous case.
